title: How Ethereum Staking Stacks Up in the Proof-of-Stake Landscape - CoinDesk
content: This constant stream of new staking participants — the current number of validators sits at about 800,000 — has been so substantial that it has even led some to propose a hard cap on the number of new validators that can enter the pool on any given day. The rationale being that the current “churn” limit of 12 new validators per epoch, (which equates to 2,700 validators, 86,400 ETH, or roughly $138,000,000 per day), is unsustainable long term. A queue controls how many can join at any given time and the capacity of that queue increases as the network grows*, which could eventually stress the functionality of the network.

title: Ethereum decentralization takes hit as Blocknative discontinues its relayer - Blockworks
content:
Concerns about increased centralization on the Ethereum network have intensified, following Blocknative’s decision to discontinue its MEV-boost relay on Tuesday.

Relayers play a pivotal role in settling transactions on Ethereum. They ensure timely and efficient processing, bridging the gap between users and the blockchain by batching and broadcasting transactions. With the exit of Blocknative, the relayer landscape is becoming increasingly concentrated. At time of writing, only four relayers remain active on the network.

Following Ethereum’s transition to proof-of-stake, the roles of block proposing and block building became distinct processes. MEV-boost software was developed to facilitate an efficient market between these proposers, which submit transaction bundles to validators, and builders, which organize the transactions in a specific order.

Following the Merge, a group of well-resourced Ethereum block builders, formerly including Blocknative, began running their own relays.

Today, nearly all Ethereum transactions use MEV-boost relays. 93% of Ethereum blocks created in the past 14 days made use of MEV-boost, according to data compiled on mevboost.pics. At the time that data was compiled, five entities were responsible for relaying 98% of the MEV-boosted transactions, per relayscan.io.

Loading Tweet..

According to Blocknative, it dropped its MEV-boost relay because continuing was no longer economically viable. The four remaining relayers collect no fees for their services, making this core piece of Ethereum infrastructure unprofitable for its operators. A recent Flashbots community proposal aims to start a “PBS Guild” which would solicit Ethereum community donations in part to reward relayers.

Uri Klarman, CEO of relaying entity Bloxroute, believes that a relayer fee mechanism should be activated, however. He suggests that block validators anticipate this move.

“I heard from multiple validators, like, ‘yeah, we don’t understand how you [haven’t charged] us until this point,’” Klarman told Blockworks.

Klarman said relayer fees would require some level of consensus between the remaining relaying entities and, ideally, the Ethereum community. If the economic incentive problem isn’t fixed, though, Klarman thinks the perceived centralization of MEV-boost relays could grow worse.

“In a year, if everything stays the same […] I think it’s very reasonable that there will be [fewer] relays than there are today,” Klarman said.

Elias Simos, the CEO of Ethereum data platform Rated, told Blockworks he is ambivalent toward a future where Ethereum continues to rely on its four major relayers.

“They’re demonstrably long-term actors in the space, so they have a lot to lose [if Ethereum is harmed],” Simos said. “But at the same time, is that enough?”

Updated Sept. 28, 2023 at 10:22 am ET: Updated to clarify that Ethereum transactions are now handled by four relayers.

Don’t miss the next big story – join our free daily newsletter.

title: Ethereum OFAC compliance dips to 45% post-Merge upgrade - Cointelegraph
content:
The historic Merge upgrade from Sept. 2022 — which marked Ethereum’s transition from proof-of-work (PoW) to proof-of-stake (PoS) — resulted in the overall decline in compliance with standards laid down by the Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC).

Ethereum blocks adhering to OFAC compliance censor certain transactions, which has a negative impact on the neutrality of the Ethereum ecosystem. In early August 2022, OFAC sanctioned Tornado Cash and several Ether (ETH) addresses associated with it due to its ability to mask and anonymize transactions.

Before the Merge upgrade, Ethereum’s OFAC compliance increased exponentially as entities such as crypto exchanges opted to run censoring MEV-Boost relays on their validators. The list of top censorship offenders is populated by popular platforms such as Binance, Celsius Network, Bitfinex, Ledger Live, Huobi (HTX) and Coinbase, according to MEV Watch data.

List of entities running censoring MEV relays on their validators are actively harming Ethereum’s credible neutrality. Source: MEV Watch

However, the overall OFAC compliance of Ethereum blocks has declined significantly. In November 2022, 78% of the total Ethereum blocks complied with OFAC regulations. As of today, Sept. 27, Ethereum’s OFAC compliance dropped to 30%, recording an overall reduction of 57%.

Post-Merge daily OFAC-compliant Ethereum blocks. Source: MEV Watch

Countering OFAC compliance requires operators to use relays that do not censor according to OFAC compliance requirements. There are seven major MEV-boost relays that are most commonly used: Flashbots, BloXroute Max Profit, BloXroute Ethical, BloXroute Regulated, BlockNative, Manifold and Eden. However, not all systems adhere to OFAC compliance, according to MEV Watch:

“Of the 7 available major relays only 3 do not censor according to OFAC compliance requirements.”

It is also important to note that not all blocks built by OFAC-compliant relays are censoring; however, all blocks built by OFAC-compliant relays will censor when non-compliant transactions are broadcast to the network.

While OFAC regulations primarily target United States-based organizations, validators outside the U.S. must consider running non-censoring relays for the benefit of the network.

Related: US Treasury sanctions Ethereum wallet tied to cartel over ‘illicit fentanyl trafficking’

Amid Ethereum’s reduced OFAC compliance, Grayscale made the decision to abandon all the rights to PoW Ethereum tokens (ETHPoW). However, the decision was attributed to a lack of liquidity in the market. According to an official announcement:

“As such, it is not possible to exercise the rights to acquire and sell the ETHPoW tokens, and on behalf of the record date shareholders, Grayscale is abandoning the rights to these assets.”

On the other hand, some cryptocurrency investment firms like ETC Group have attempted to launch dedicated EthereumPoW exchange-traded products (ETPs).

Magazine: ‘AI has killed the industry’: EasyTranslate boss on adapting to change

title: Ethereum Revenue Soars to $10B, Outshining Tech Titans Microsoft and Facebook - CCN.com
content:
Key Takeaways

Despite uncertainty and a YoY decline, Ethereum has generated $10Bn in income in seven years.

It surpassed software giants such as Microsoft and Facebook.

As per sources, Ethereum’s network revenue could grow to $51Bn per year by 2030 from the current $2.6Bn.

Since its inception in 2015, Vitalik Buterin’s cryptocurrency, Ethereum, has amassed $10 billion in income, beating Facebook and Microsoft in terms of growth rate.

In practice, whereas Ethereum would have taken 7.5 years to reach the $10 billion revenue milestone, Facebook (now Meta) appears to have taken somewhat longer and Microsoft a full 19 years.

As Crypto Portfolio Manager at cryptocurrency brokerage firm Caleb & Brown points out , such a result suggests that crypto protocols, like software, may be the next to become worldwide.

Factors Influencing Ethereum’s Earnings

Ethereum’s popularity is driven by its versatility. Unlike Bitcoin, which primarily serves as a secure transactional network, Ethereum distinguishes itself by enabling the deployment of complex protocols across diverse industries. This adaptability makes Ethereum a preferred platform for applications in finance, gaming, art, and more.

As of September 26, Ethereum’s native cryptocurrency, ETH was trading at approximately $1,625, with the Ethereum network boasting a market capitalization exceeding $195 billion.

Ethereum primarily generates revenue through transaction fees, denominated in gas. The cost of these fees varies depending on the complexity of the transaction.

Basic transfers have lower fees, while smart contract-based transactions, which ensure trustless execution, are usually more expensive. Transaction costs increase with the complexity of network transactions.

Ethereum’s transaction fee revenue goes to validators, who secure the network and confirm transactions. They earn block rewards and transaction fees for their role, incentivizing them to maintain network integrity and smooth operations.

Positive ETH Price Outlook

Positive predictions on the price of Ethereum (ETH) appear to be prevalent in September 2023.

These projections are based on ETH’s past performance in comparison to BTC and its four-year halving cycle.

In reality, it appears that ETH has outperformed BTC during bull markets, but during bear markets, ETH looks to suffer more than BTC.

At the time of writing, the price of ETH had increased by more than 15% over the previous year. In fact, ETH is currently valued $1.627 . However, by mid-April 2023, ETH had reached an annual price high of more than $2,000.

A $51 Billion Revenue Projection by 2030

In conclusion, the projected revenue potential of reaching $51 billion by 2030 not only underscores the untapped opportunities within the Ethereum network but also signifies the promising growth prospects that decentralized platforms may experience in the years ahead.

Despite market uncertainties, Ethereum’s versatility and applications position it for sustained growth, showcasing blockchain’s transformative potential across industries

title: Will Ethereum Recover? - Watcher Guru
content:
Will Ethereum Recover? A Deep Dive into the Future of ETH

Cryptocurrencies have taken the financial world by storm, and Ethereum (ETH) has been at the forefront of this revolution.

As one of the largest cryptocurrencies by market capitalization, Ethereum has gained significant attention from investors, traders, and enthusiasts alike.

However, the recent market volatility and regulatory concerns have left many wondering: Will Ethereum recover and continue its upward trajectory?

In this article, we will explore the future of Ethereum, analyzing key factors such as its transition to a proof-of-stake (PoS) blockchain, price forecasts, and the overall market sentiment.

Also read: Cloud & Crypto-Based Gaming the End for Xbox, PlayStation?

Source: CNN

Understanding Ethereum’s Current Challenges

Before diving into Ethereum’s recovery potential, it’s essential to understand its current challenges.

One of the main concerns is the transition from a proof-of-work (PoW) to a proof-of-stake (PoS) blockchain, also known as the Ethereum 2.0 upgrade.

This transition addresses scalability issues and reduces energy consumption, making the network more sustainable.

The shift to PoS introduces a new consensus mechanism where validators are chosen to create new blocks based on the number of coins they hold and are willing to “stake” as collateral.

While PoS has several advantages over PoW, such as increased security and scalability, the transition process has been complex and time-consuming.

As a result, Ethereum has faced delays and uncertainty, causing some investors to question its future prospects.

Additionally, the crypto market has experienced significant volatility, with prices of many cryptocurrencies fluctuating wildly.

Concerns over regulatory actions and potential bans in certain countries have also added to the uncertainty surrounding Ethereum and other cryptocurrencies. These challenges have led to price fluctuations and dampened investor sentiment.

Also read: Crypto-Friendly Banks in Europe?

The Potential of Proof-of-Stake (PoS) Blockchain

One of the key factors driving Ethereum’s ability to recover is the transition to a PoS blockchain. PoS has several advantages over PoW, including reduced energy consumption, increased security, and improved scalability.

PoS allows for a more sustainable and environmentally friendly blockchain network by eliminating the need for resource-intensive mining.

The shift to PoS is a vital Ethereum milestone, addressing network scalability issues.

Additionally, PoS will reward users for staking their ETH in the network.

The PoS shift will introduce staking rewards for users who participate by staking their ETH.

This incentivizes users to hold and stake their coins, potentially reducing selling pressure and increasing demand for ETH. As more users participate in staking, the network’s security is strengthened, further enhancing Ethereum’s appeal to investors.

Price Forecasts: What the Experts Say

Source: Forbes

Price forecasts can provide valuable insights into the future performance of Ethereum.

While it’s important to approach these forecasts cautiously, they can help inform investment decisions and shape market sentiment.

Let’s look at some of the price predictions made by experts and analysts.

CoinCodex Study

According to a study by CoinCodex, Ethereum could recover to a price of $28,700 by the end of 2025. This analysis considers Ethereum’s price volatility and the cyclical nature of Bitcoin halvings, which historically put upward pressure on the entire crypto market.

Crypto trader Kaleo has predicted that Ethereum could hit $3,000 in 2023. Kaleo has a track record of successful market trend predictions, although predictions should be cautiously approached.

Renowned investor Cathie Wood, CEO of Ark Invest, is massively bullish on Ethereum. She has estimated that Ethereum could reach all-time highs of between $170,000 and $180,000 by 2030.

Wood is optimistic because Ethereum can disrupt traditional finance and underpins the DeFi ecosystem.

These predictions highlight the potential for Ethereum’s price to rise significantly in the coming years. However, it’s important to remember that the crypto market is highly volatile and subject to various external factors, so caution should always be exercised when making investment decisions.

Is Ethereum a Good Investment?

Whether Ethereum is a good investment depends on various factors, including your risk tolerance, investment goals, and market outlook.

While Ethereum has shown significant growth and a strong track record, it’s essential to consider both the potential rewards and risks of investing in this cryptocurrency.

One of the key advantages of Ethereum is its position as the leading smart contract platform. Smart contracts are self-executing contracts with predefined conditions, enabling decentralized applications to run on the Ethereum blockchain.

The widespread adoption of smart contracts has opened up various possibilities, from decentralized finance to non-fungible tokens (NFTs) and decentralized exchanges (DEXs).

Furthermore, the transition to a PoS blockchain with Ethereum 2.0 has the potential to increase the network’s scalability and security significantly. This upgrade could attract more developers and users to the Ethereum ecosystem, driving demand for ETH and potentially increasing its value.

However, it’s important to consider the risks associated with investing in Ethereum. The crypto market is highly volatile, and prices can fluctuate rapidly. Regulatory actions and government interventions can also impact the market sentiment and the value of cryptocurrencies.

Additionally, technological risks, such as potential vulnerabilities in smart contracts or security breaches, should be considered.

Whether Ethereum is a good investment depends on your circumstances and risk tolerance.

Doing thorough research, consulting with financial advisors, and only investing what you can afford to lose is always recommended.

The Future of Ethereum: Eth Price Around the Merge

Source: Reuters

One of the most anticipated events for Ethereum is the upcoming merge, which will combine the existing PoW chain with the new PoS chain.

This merger aims to bring together the best of both worlds, combining the security and decentralization of PoW with the efficiency and sustainability of PoS.

The merge is expected to impact the Ethereum network and its price significantly.

As the network transitions to a more energy-efficient and scalable PoS consensus mechanism, it could attract more investors and developers to the ecosystem. This increased interest and participation could drive up the demand for ETH and positively impact its price.

Moreover, the merger will also introduce changes to the Ethereum supply dynamics. With PoS, users can stake their ETH and earn staking rewards.

This process incentivizes users to hold onto their coins, potentially reducing the selling pressure and increasing demand for ETH. As the supply of ETH on exchanges decreases, it could create upward pressure on the price.

While predicting the exact price movements around the merger is challenging, the general sentiment is optimistic. The market anticipates the merger will unlock new potential for Ethereum, positioning it as a leading blockchain platform and potentially driving its price higher.

Technical Analysis and Price Forecasts

Technical analysis can provide valuable insights into the future price movements of Ethereum based on historical data and market trends.

Analysts can make predictions about the future direction of ETH’s price by analyzing price charts and using various indicators.

Based on artificial intelligence-assisted technical analysis, some price forecasts suggest that Ethereum could experience significant growth in the coming years.

These forecasts consider historical price patterns, trading volume, and market sentiment.

However, it’s important to remember that technical analysis is not foolproof and should be used with other forms of analysis and information.

The crypto market is highly volatile and can be influenced by various factors, including market sentiment, regulatory actions, and global economic conditions.

Long-Term Ethereum Price Outlook

Looking beyond the short-term price fluctuations, the long-term outlook for Ethereum to recover remains promising. As one of the most established cryptocurrencies with a robust ecosystem, Ethereum is well-positioned to continue its growth and innovation.

Growing dApp use, DeFi growth, and Ethereum’s industry integration boost its long-term potential.

Ethereum’s smart contracts and scalability enhancements attract developers and users alike.

Ethereum’s solid foundation and blockchain’s rising appeal hint at a resilient and thriving future despite future challenges.

Source: Pixabay

Conclusion: The Future of Ethereum

This article explores Ethereum’s chance to recover and its future, hinging on PoS transition, price predictions, and market sentiment.

While Ethereum faces challenges and uncertainties, it also presents significant opportunities for investors and enthusiasts.

The shift to a PoS blockchain with Ethereum 2.0 has the potential to address scalability issues, increase security, and reduce energy consumption, making the network more efficient and sustainable.

Price forecasts and technical analysis suggest that Ethereum could experience significant growth in the coming years, driven by increased adoption, staking rewards, and market sentiment.

However, it’s important to cautiously approach investing in Ethereum and other cryptocurrencies.

The crypto market is highly volatile, and prices can fluctuate rapidly. Regulatory actions and technological risks should also be considered. Conduct thorough research, seek advice from financial professionals, and only invest what you can afford to lose.

In conclusion, while the future of Ethereum is not without challenges, its strong fundamentals, growing ecosystem, and innovation potential make it an exciting cryptocurrency to watch.

As the crypto market evolves, Ethereum’s recovery and growth potential will be shaped by technological advancements, market dynamics, and investor sentiment.
